intro: Eupatorium fuertesii, commonly known as the Florida blue mistflower, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. Eupatorium fuertesii plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining wetland ecosystems.
